prompt: What are the pros and cons of having sales people that are jointly working on a deal negotiate the commission split between themselves? What alternatives exist to that approach? Based on the relative pros and cons, what would you recommend?
title: How to Negotiate Commission Splits in SaaS Deals?
originalTitle: Negotiating Commission Splits in Joint Enterprise SaaS Deals: Pros, Cons & Alternatives
socialQuestion: How to Negotiate Commission Splits in SaaS Deals?
pullQuotes: but if handled poorly they become “a painful source of distraction and lost productivity”
Money disputes tend to damage trust and create tension, hurting team relationships and performance
Predefined splits can foster a collaborative culture since reps know that helping on a deal will still earn them a share.
Knowing that every extra effort or achievement on a deal could increase one’s commission share incentivizes reps to go the extra mile.
The more an approach emphasizes “collective reward” (predefined or team-based) versus “individual claim” (negotiated or strictly performance-based), the more it tends to solidify teamwork.
sceneDescription: Three sales reps in crisp suits huddle around a small conference table, each clutching a slice of a large pie resting in the center. They eye one another’s portions warily, one poised to measure the slices with a ruler while another looks thoughtfully at a chart of neatly separated bars lying untouched beside them. The room is otherwise sparse, with only a simple clock ticking overhead and a single door cracked open, hinting at an outside manager’s presence. The tension in their expressions contrasts with the calm, orderly scene.
